data.question: If he were here, could be more fun?

option.a: He was expected but did not show up to make the occasion lively
option.b: There was no fun because he was not present
option.c: He did not show up so the occasion lacked much fun
option.d: He was being expected to supply more fun

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: He wasn't present, so they didn't have as much fun as they would have had if he had attended the event.

option.b: The meeting's date was off for strange reasons
option.c: The meeting was called as a result of obstacles hitherto unknown
option.d: The meeting broke off as a bird's eye closely

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

data.solution: A view from a very high place that allows you to see a large area

data.question: Even though Susan was the last in the examination, her result wasn't too different from what had been expected.

option.d: She had not been serious with her studies

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: This means her result turned out as everyone expected despite what had happened during the examination

data.question: Mrs. Adamu does all her work with more haste, less speed.

option.a: She accept whatever she does with more haste and speed
option.b: She approaches whatever she does hurriedly
option.c: She addresses everything she does very quickly to avoid mistakes
option.d: She does everything carefully to avoid mistakes

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: This mean that if you try to do things too quickly, it will take you longer in the end.

data.question: She stopped her education as her uncle left her in the lurch?

option.c: Her uncle refused to help her

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: To abandon somebody; especially, to abandon somebody and leave him or her in a difficult situation.

data.question: The plan to upgrade the dispensary to a general hospital did not materialized?

option.a: The plan did not meet the required specifications
option.b: The arrangement did not work out as wished
option.c: It was difficult to obtain the materials
option.d: The materials purchased were not the right ones

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: If a possible or expected event does not materialize, it does not happen.

data.question: Okon's company took a hit last year?

option.b: His company made a huge success last year
option.c: His company was badly damaged last year
option.d: His company was established last year

data.section: LEXIS, STRUCTURE AND ORAL FORMS In each of the questions 26 to 33, select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: To suffer heavy losses or be badly affected (by something).

data.question: Since its <u>inception</u> 1983, the newspaper has attracted thousands of readers?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Inception; the commencement or starting point of something

data.question: Mrs. Asio wanted her sister to stop being so <u>detached</u>?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Detached: separate or disconnected.

data.question: Lantana <u>dwelt</u> in a ruined cottage on the hillside?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Dwelt; to live in or at a specified place.

data.question: The mistake brought the show to an <u>ignominious</u> end?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Ignominious; deserving or causing public disgrace or shame.

data.question: He <u>compliments</u> me on my way of doing things?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: compliments; a polite expression of praise or admiration.

data.question: The girl is angry with her friend who had <u>ensnared</u> her into this relationship?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Ensnared;   to trap or gain power over (someone) by dishonest or underhand means.

data.question: Their new house was roofed with <u>corrugated</u> sheets?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: corrugated; (of a material or surface) shaped into a series of parallel ridges and grooves so as to give added rigidity and strength. Folded

data.question: The stockbroker said it was an <u>astute</u> move to sell the shares then?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution:
Astute; having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.

shrewd; having or showing sharp powers of judgement; astute.

data.question: The principal described Oche as the most <u>tactful</u> person he had ever worked with?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution:
Tactful;  having or showing skill and sensitivity in dealing with others or with difficult issues.

Discreet; careful and prudent in one's speech or actions, especially to keep something confidential or avoid embarrassment.

data.question: The old woman is suffering from <u>dementia</u>?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Dementia; a chronic or persistent disorder of the mental processes caused by brain disease or injury and marked by memory disorders, personality changes, and impaired reasoning.

data.question: Some drugs have a <u>deleterious</u> effect on a child's development?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: Deleterious; causing harm or damage.

data.question: Fila has always been described as <u>belligerent</u>?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution:
Belligerent; hostile and aggressive.

combative; ready or eager to fight or argue.

data.question: Laraba saw a <u>forlorn</u> little figure sitting outside the class?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution: forlorn; pitifully sad and abandoned or lonely.

data.question: The circular <u>supersedes</u> all previous correspondence on the matter?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution:
For something to ''supersede'' it means to take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use); supplant.

synonymes; replace · supplant · take the place of · take over from · substitute for · displace · oust · overthrow · remove · unseat · override · succeed · come after · step into the shoes of · crowd out · fill someone's boots. 

the closest in meaning in the above options is ''displace'' which means take over the place, position, or role of.

data.question: Her problem was <u>exacerbated</u> by the loss of her father?
data.section: In each of the questions 34 to 48, Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).
data.solution:
Exacerbate; make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.

Aggravated; make (a problem, injury, or offence) worse or more serious.

data.question: The warring communities were <u>coerced</u> into negotiating a settlement?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
coerced; obtain (something) from someone by using force or threats.

persuaded; provide a sound reason for (someone) to do something.

data.question: His father served as a <u>mercenary</u> in the army?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
A mercenary is a professional soldier hired to serve in a foreign army.

while a recruit is a person newly enlisted in the armed forces and not yet fully trained.

data.question: Jummai is <u>cruel</u> to her husband?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
Cruel; wilfully causing pain or suffering to others, or feeling no concern about it.

passionate; having, showing, or caused by strong feelings or beliefs.

data.question: The teacher who beat the student was treated with <u>mercy</u>?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
Mercy; to have compassion or forgiveness shown towards someone whom it is within one's power to punish or harm.

vengeance; punishment inflicted or retribution exacted for an injury or wrong.

data.question: His wife hates his <u>garrulous</u> attitude?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
Garrulous; excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.

Reticent; not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily. Reserved

data.question: Agoshito is a <u>callow</u> youth', said the teacher?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution: Callow; (of a young person) inexperienced and immature.

data.question: What you are asking me to do is a <u>herculean</u> task?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:

Option D ''easy'' is the opposite in meaning

data.question: Nkechi was a <u>novice</u> when she was first employed?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.

data.question: I do not trust him', he said, in a rare moment of <u>candour</u>?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.

data.solution: Anaemic; lacking in colour, spirit, or vitality. To be weak, feeble

data.solution:
Inconceivable; not capable of being imagined or grasped mentally. unbelievable.

Credible; able to be believed; convincing.

data.question: She only gives a <u>superficial</u> impression of warmth and friendliness?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution:
superficial; Fake or artificial. existing or occurring at or on the surface.

Deep; very intense or extreme.  extending far down from the top or surface.

data.question: As a <u>prudent</u> businessman, Adeyi does not leave anything to chance.

prudent; acting with or showing care and thought for the future. 

careless; not giving sufficient attention or thought to avoiding harm or errors.

data.question: His <u>antipathy</u> affected the growth of is business?

data.solution:
Antipathy; is defined as a strong feeling of opposition or dislike. 

Receptiveness; willingness to listen to and accept new ideas and suggestions:

data.question: Okonkwo's <u>lethal</u> right foot the magic in the football match?
data.section: In each of the questions 49 to 63 choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.
data.solution: Lethal; (in a sporting context) means very accurate or skillful. lethal is defined as 'very dangerous and able to kill you' The opposite in meaning is option D ''harmless''

data.question: When his car tyre ......... on the way, he did not know what to do.
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
When his car tyre burst on the way, he did not know what to do.

Although bursted is not a word in English, some writers erroneously use it as a past tense or past participle for burst. As mentioned above, burst is itself the past tense form of this verb, making bursted unnecessary and incorrect.

data.question: Lami's father ........ as a gardener when he was young, but now he is a driver.
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Lami's father used to work as a gardener when he was young, but now he is a driver.

Used to work; this is to say that something repeatedly happened in the past like

data.question: ........ he switches on the light, the shadow disappears?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Whenever he switches on the light, the shadow disappears?

Whenever; at whatever time; on whatever occasion (emphasizing a lack of restriction).

data.question: The policemen became suspicious as the hoodlums ......in their office?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
The policemen became suspicious as the hoodlums ferreted about in their office?

 If you ferret about for something, you look for it in a lot of different places or in a place where it is hidden.

data.question: It is important that you clear the refuse in front of your house every ........?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
It is important that you clear the refuse in front of your house every fortnight 

Fortnight; a period of two weeks.

data.question: Suara needn't come with us, .......?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
When there is no special emphasis, the rule of thumb often applies that a positive sentence has a negative tag and vice versa. This form may express confidence, or seek confirmation of the asker's opinion or belief.

For example: It's cold (positive), isn't it (negative)? just like in the question above,

''Suara needn't (negative) come with us'' Need she? (positive) correlates with the question tag

data.question: Unoka .... the whole house to find his missing wristwatch?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Unoka scoured the whole house to finds his missing wristwatch?

If you scour something such as a place or a book, you make a thorough search of it to try to find what you are looking for.

data.question: Ife asked me ....... ?

option.b: what is it by my time

data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution: Ife asked me what time it was.

data.question: There are many ways to kill a rat, so we should be..... in our approach to the task ahead of us?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
There are many ways to kill a rat, so we should be eclectic  in our approach to the task ahead of us?

Eclectic; /ɪˈklɛktɪk/ deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources.

data.question: Audu took these actions purely ...... his own career?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Audu took these actions purely in furtherance of  his own career?

In furtherance of; this means the advancement of a scheme or interest.

data.question: Here is Mr. Odumusu who teaches English ....... in our school?

data.solution: The correct spelling is pronunciation [prəˌnʌnsɪˈeɪʃ(ə)n], this refers to the way in which a word is pronounced.

data.question: Instead of ......., she lied?

data.question: Of the three girls, Uka is the ........?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Of the three girls, Uka is the naughtiest?

Naughtiest; (especially of a child) badly behaved; disobedient.

data.question: I wonder how he will ......being absent from school for a long time.
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
make-up in this regards, refers to a supplementary test or assignment given to a student who missed or failed the original one.

make-up best suits the sentence.

data.question: Please sit on the ....... ?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Please sit on the carrier ?

carrier; a person or thing that carries, holds, or conveys something.

data.question: I want to .......this chance to acquaint you the latest development?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
I want to  seize  this chance to acquaint you the latest development?

seize; to take (an opportunity) eagerly and decisively.

data.question: Getting a well paid job nowadays is an ...... task?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Getting a well paid job nowadays is an uphill task?

When something is an uphill task or an uphill struggle, it's a difficult thing to do.

data.question: The secretary has no right to ....... my affairs?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution: The secretary has no right to meddle in my affairs?

data.question: Bola studiously avoided ....... the questions?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution:
Bola studiously avoided answering the questions?

This means Bola deliberately avoided answering the question.

data.question: The school authority dismissed him for ...... but I won't tell you about it yet?
data.section: In each of the questions 64 to 83, choose the option that best completes the gap(s).
data.solution: The school authority dismissed him for a certain reason but I won't tell you about it yet?

data.question: termination?
data.section: In each of the questions 93 to 98 choose the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.
data.solution:
words ending with ''tion are usually stressed on the syllable before the ''tion''

Hence the word will be stressed as ter-mi-NA-tion

data.question: Uche LOVES Toyota cars?

option.b: What brand of car Uche love?

data.section: In each of the questions 93 to 98 choose the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.
data.solution: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer.

data.question: The POLICE arrested the suspect.

option.a: Did the police placate the suspect?
option.d: Did the police arrest the suspect?

data.section: In each of the questions 93 to 98 choose the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.
data.solution: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer.

data.question: Maiduguri is the CAPITAL of Borno State.

option.a: Is Maiduguri the capital of Plateau State?
option.b: Which State is Maiduguri the capital of?
option.c: Is Maiduguri a town in Borno State?
option.d: What is the capital Borno State?

data.section: In each of the questions 93 to 98 choose the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.
data.solution:
In answering questions on emphatic stress, the interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. The emphasized word from the question above is ''capital''. Option C contradicts the statement.

Is Maiduguri a town in Borno State? The underlined word contradicts the emphasized word, ''capital''.

data.question: My eldest son, who is in Lagos, studying English.

option.a: only my son is in lagos studying english
option.b: my only son is in lagos studying english
option.c: one of my sons is in lagos studying english
option.d: my sons are in lagos but, only one is studying english

data.section: In each of the questions 99 to 100 select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution:
The speaker said his eldest son, that means he has more than one child but is only talking about one.

This also means, his son is a student, he lives in Lagos and studying in English language

data.question: If I went to the village I would visit the King.

option.a: If i go to the village, i will visit the king
option.b: I did not go to the village and I did not visit the king
option.c: All the times I went to the village I also visited the king
option.d: I will visit the king when I go to the village

data.section: In each of the questions 99 to 100 select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: He hasn't visited the village yet, but when he does, he will visit the king.
